greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = -a(n-1) + 3*a(n-2), starting a(1)=1, a(2)=2.
comment: Equals eigensequence of triangle A112555. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 30 2009
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-1,3).
formula: a(n) = term (1,1) of X^n, where X = the 2 X 2 matrix [1,-1; -1,-2].
a(n) = ((-1)^n/2)*( (x^n + y^n) - 5*( (x^n - y^n)/(x-y) )], where 2*x = 1 + sqrt(13) and 2*y = 1 - sqrt(13). - _Paolo P. Lava_, Aug 01 2008 [modified by _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 26 2019]
maple: seq(coeff(series(x*(1+3*x)/(1+x-3*x^2), x, n+1), x, n), n = 1..30); # _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 26 2019
program: (MAGMA) R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), 30); Coefficients(R!( x*(1+3*x)/(1+x-3*x^2) )); // _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 26 2019
(MAGMA) a:=[1,2]; [n le 2 select a[n] else -Self(n-1) + 3*Self(n-2): n in [1..30]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Jan 02 2020
(GAP) a:=[1,2];; for n in [3..30] do a[n]:=-a[n-1]+3*a[n-2]; od; a; # _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 26 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, May 10 2008
